citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Environmental Data Service, National Climatic Center
citeinfo.title: Monthly and Annual Marine Weather for the Pacific Ocean

abstract.p: Includes monthly and annual means and extremes of dry-bulb temperature, dew-point temperature, sea temperature, pressure, and clouds; monthly and annual percentage frequency of visibility and of wind speed and direction; percentage frequency of wave height and direction; weather. Area covered ranges from 40-180 degrees W and from 55 degrees S-78 degrees N. A station location map is also included.
Vol.1 (1961)-v.10(1970) available from the NOAA Library System: URL http://www.lib.noaa.gov/. Data for 1971- continued in digital form only by COADS project.

descript.purpose: This publication is in the National Oceanic & Atmospheric Administration Library, and is one of many books, atlases, maps, charts and other printed materials received by NOAA from many nations over the years.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.
